<resp>{'time': 1515946649106, 'text': 'All toys given during our 7 days of Christmas Distribution are new. We do apologize and cannot figure out how you received a used "chewed up" board game as toys come in on pallets from our vendors and are packaged in clear plastic. If you need our services in 2018 we hope that your experience will be much better. Thank you for your candid review.'}< /resp><gmap_id>0x80c353580596406b:0x14df8b1631a5b882</gmap_id></record></dataset><record>

<Text>tl;dr    I really recommend Adrian, and this place. Everything is high quality.

Book your appointment; and stop considering if it's worth it or not, because it's well worth the money. If you don't know what type of cut you want, don't worry, they'll know what will look good, but if you do know, they'll probably make it better. And if you wanna create that great hairstyle everyday, they'll show/teach you how.

My first cut here was ~2 years ago, and I had a few cuts with Ziri, and can recommend her, she does a great job. After trying a few other places, it was obvious 18|8 is top quality in SD, and I came back to try another stylist. My cuts with Adrian have only been very clean, very professional, and very relaxed. < text>
Professional, personalized and hassle-free service!

I recently purchased a Rolex Datejust 41 from Bhindi Jewelers.  This was my first experience purchasing from Bhindi, and it will definitely not be my last.  Their Artesia, CA flagship store is a bit out of my way but I cannot say enough about the service and attention I received from Aman.  I initially submitted an inquiry through their website and I expected the typical, "sorry, we don't have that model", never to be heard from again.  But instead, Aman kept in touch with me over the course of a couple of weeks with inventory updates on different models/options that she thought I might be interested in even though not meeting my exact preferences.  I was thrilled when she contacted me as soon as they received the exact model I was looking for (literally within a few weeks), and I sped down there the next day to make the purchase.

Their showroom is expansive, comfortable and well laid-out.  They also had quite a number of watches in their cases to choose from, in contrast to other Rolex ADs that seem to have barren cases at this time.

Thanks again Aman, and hopefully I can make another grail purchase soon.<//text>

<text>I had a horrible, backstabbing experience with Bhindi Artesia location.
I purchased several Rolexes from my sales rep, and I referred a friend who also purchased a Rolex there. He promised me Rolex 1 (model confidential) on 3/25/2020, but COVID-19 happened and he said he would hold it for me until the store opened. He texted me 5/23/2020 that they will be open for business by appointment only. He said I could pick up the watch, and when I talked to him by phone, I briefly mentioned my other friend was interested in purchasing a Rolex.
I went to Bhindi on 5/24/2020, and due to new guidelines, they were checking temperature for COVID-19 symptoms. There was nobody in line, and the security guard was going to scan us. However, the security guard saw his boss driving in, so he told us to wait while he moved the cone from a parking spot. We kept waiting until the boss parked and walked inside Bhindi (without temperature check) - for about 10 minutes in 100-degree weather. First and second person went in OK, third person was at 99 degrees, and fourth person at 100 degrees. No signs of headache or COVID-19. For one, they could have scanned us and let us in before his boss came. He was barely pulling in, and we wouldn't have had issues with the forehead scanner if they didn't make us WAIT IN THE SUN for 10 minutes. Second, if they're going to make us wait, they should have had a tent for us to wait in the shade. Of course we're going to get spiked temperatures if the surface of our forehead is facing the sun - stupid. The manager comes out and proposes the solution, "Why don't you wait in your car in AC for a few minutes and re-scan?"
The security guard was being unnecessarily, overly polite to his boss, and not considerate of customers. During my drive home, my sales rep called and texted me saying they will fix procedures since this is new to them. OK, so we went back to Bhindi. This time, as soon as we arrived, they let us in through the first door and measured our temperature in the shade. We passed and went in to see our sales rep.
Now I remind you we were promised Rolex 1 on 3/25/2020. He texted us first to have us come in to Bhindi to purchase and pick up Rolex 1. That was the deal - Rolex 1 only. I know my friend was waiting on Rolex 2, so I asked him if he had this model available. He said yes, so I asked him to hold it (this was Saturday, and I was going in on Sunday - next day).
I come in to Bhindi to purchase Rolex 1, but now the deal has changed. My sales rep said I have to buy BOTH Rolex 1 and Rolex 2. That was the new deal - both or none. Me and my friend were going to buy it regardless, but the fact that he HAD to say it that way - both or none - made me feel confused/mad. I wasn't using my friend as leverage - I was trying to help my friend AND I was trying to help my sales rep.
I still don't understand why he suddenly changed the deal. My sales rep said it was the manager, but no explanation or apologies from the manager for this misunderstanding. Honestly, we would have bought both but the fact that it was a both or none deal, the fact that he MADE us feel like we were using Rolex 2 as leverage when he promised us Rolex 1 two months ago, the fact that he changed the deal OVERNIGHT - was just negative.
The manager never apologized. What's the use building a relationship with your sales rep (and management) when they go back on their word.
I'm curious if Rolex knows their authorized dealers to sell their watches this way. It really deducts from the brand. Please don't drop their name value.<//text><pictures>None< /pictures>< Response>
None</Response>

< Text>
This is their flagship store. They carry all kinds of jewelry and luxury brand watches from Rolex, Tudor, Omega, Hublot, Cartier and list goes so on. I really want to recommend their sale associate name CK. He is very detailed and friendly about showing the jewelry and watches you want to see. Because when you are at the store, you dont want to be pressured after trying out few pieces. He also, can get to business and get you the best out the door prices. Cant say much about what he could do but stop in and look for CK.<//Text>

I have been a customer of Bhindi Jewellers since 1999 and I must say they are the most trusted and honest Jewellers for me and my family.
Bhindi Jewellers has the most extensive collection of Diamond and Gold jewelry along with Rolex, Hublot, Cartier and other designer watches.
The Bhindi family of ownership are very courteous, down to earth and no pressure selling.
Special mention goes to Senior Sales Manager Ashok Patel who has been helping me and my family with all our jewelry and watch needs for the last 2 decades.< /Review>

<Name>William Kim<//Name><date>1505603191496</date><userid>104668230284215253955<//userid><Rate>1</Rate><pictures>None<//pictures>< Text>
Worst customer service I've had at a higher end jewelry establishment. Walked in to be greeted by the security and a woman. All was good until a gentleman approached me and my friend while sucking in his teeth giving us the "up and down stare".
They say never judge a book by its cover and this sales representative did just that. Had cash in hand to purchase a very nice and expensive watch. He showed us the watch and that was it. Never said a word to tell us about the watch or anything. At that point I decided to leave the store and purchase from another authorized rolex dealer with a much better purchasing experience.
Never again with this establishment. Complaint will be filed with Rolex as well. This is not how a Rolex authorized dealer should be.</Text>

< Review>
Wonderful place to buy jewelry in Los Angeles.
Very welcoming ambience and highly courteous & friendly staff makes our visit to this place very memorable every time we shop here !
They have a huge collection of jewels in all price ranges. Quality is never compromised.
All staff members are humble and work with due diligence.
Notable mention goes to Meena who has always been so passionate with customers. She has lot of patience and a great attitude towards all her customers.
Also like to recognize two other staff Naina & Dolly.
All three are truly awesome.
Last but not the least - Ashok Bhai - the supervisor is a personification of modesty. A simple, down to earth person; always ready to help and ensures that every customer leaves the store highly satisfied.<//Review>

< text>
The store imposes a high level of security, giving the customers a sense of safety and security. We were greeted warmly by the sales associates. Mr. Chanda Karmokar (CK) assisted me in purchasing my very first Rolex watch. There are more models on display in contrast to the limited selections at Ben Bridge. CK presented all the models that fit my taste and budget. He was very patient with me in my decision-making process. He explained the differences in features of the watches and discussed the different payment options. My watch came with a certificate and 5 year warranty. I very well pleased with Bhindi's brand of services and, of course, with my new Rolex watch!</text>

< text>
I had been searching for a very specific Rolex watch for several months at multiple Rolex Authorized Dealers. I visited two of the Bhindi showrooms in search of my watch, and was pleasantly surprised at the level of helpfulness and service I received from both locations. Bhindi Jewlers is a multi-generational family owned and operated business. They treat their customers like a member of the family. I was delighted when I called the Artesia showroom and discovered that my Rolex had arrived! I drove to their showroom late in the evening just before closing. Ashwin Bhindi personally assisted me with my purchase, and made sure the sizing and fitment was perfect. Overall, an exceptional experience! I absolutely would recommend Bhindi Jewlers for all of your jewelry and luxury watch needs.< /text>

< Text>
Love this place! They remind me of the place we had gone to in Maui a few years ago
They have loads of flavors and pretty good size servings kiddie, regular, and large. Regular is enough to share between 2 people to be honest.  I usually get macadamia nut ice cream and my 3 flavors with a snow cap (condensed milk) always yummy. Definitely recommend to get the app belly before to save points towards rewards. Give them a try if in the area.
(pictured is a regular and a large for size reference)</Text>

< Text>
The best shaved ice I've had in a WHILE! True shaved ice, the island way. Fluffy, pillow soft ice... not that rocky, crunchy nonsense üòí Flavors are spot on, and the price is great! You can honestly split their large between 2 people, but I ate most of it solo üòÅ even the snow cap was legit. They definitely didn't skimp or take the easy way out like most shops I've tried. Heavy cream may be cheaper, but there's nothing like good old condensed milk... I'd been missing that most of all. I got the "rainbow" with (condensed milk) snowcap. The pictures don't even do it justice.< /Text>

<Text>There‚Äôre a few choices for ice cold desserts in Sawtelle Japantown and this is my favorite for its fruity tasting syrups, ‚Äúsnow cap‚Äù sweetened condensed milk and pineapple flavored frozen dole whip.

A regular shave ice includes 3 items in any combo of toppings including syrups, dole whip and Fosselman‚Äôs ice cream. You can add more toppings at additional cost.

Note: No public restroom, eat-in space very small, no validated parking.<//Text>< Pics>

< Review>
It was saturday night. After passing this location looking for a good desert and meeting disappointment, I decided that shaved ice was a good idea. I spent a minutes looking over the menu, which is very well put together, might I add. There were several very satisfied customers out front on the tables so I was sure this was a good pick.  I started to order and was interrupted with "sorry, hold on 1 second" while she walked to the back talking with someone and comes back. She said "I'm sorry we are closed and can't serve you." I looked at my watch its 11:01 they close at 11:00. Might I add that we had traveled out of our way to find a place that was open this late. I will not be returning to this location unless it is the only place in a zombie apocalypse with the cure to save the world. I hope the owner finds a way to handle situations like this in the future.< /Review>

110006480612793104456< /user_id>
<gmapID>0x80c2bb0ac534e4c9:0x475b10ab6a9be664</gmapID><Date>1453529624722</Date><Review>Brian's shaved Ice is almost as good as the product in Hawaii- still a solid choice for dessert in Sawtelle. You can choose 2/3 syrup flavors to add to your ice cone and even add dole whip or ice cream in the middle! The small is actually a good portion and sometimes even sharable amongst two if you just want a small bite.

The ice here is pretty fine with a few coarse bits. They have a huge amount of flavors to choose from and give a good amount of syrup- I'm sure you can also ask for extra. The condensed milk is always a delicious addition and they don't skimp. The dole whip is refreshing and I like the vanilla ice cream too. This is as close to Hawaiian shaved ice as you can get in West LA!<//Review><Resp>None</Resp><Pics>None< /Pics>< Rating>

< Text>
After our dinner at Hurry Curry around the corner we decided to get a little dessert-y something here. It's a cute little shop, all decked out island style, and it reminded me of my good times in HI. Anyhoo, after perusing their extensive menu I went with their combo special which was the taro shaved ice with snow cap--they had a name for it but I forgot what it was called. It really hit the spot; the shaved ice is nice and soft and had a great natural taro flavor, and I always love the "snow cap" (condensed milk) for the extra creamy flavor. They also have that Dole Whip here if you're a fan (which I am). Definitely a nice little treat.<//Text>

< userid>
104843383302677483175</userid>
< name>
Mindy Duong<//name>
< Date>
1374958578857< /Date>
<rating>5<//rating>< Review>
Best Hawaiian shaved ice I've ever had! When I first went there, I was like "how good can shaved ice be, it's just crushed ice cubes" and was delightfully proven wrong. They get their ice shavers from Hawaii, so it is true to its name and oh so delicious. The shave ice is really soft and flavorful. Make sure to get dole whip inside your shaved ice (or just separately) to round out your Hawaiian experience!!

Sometimes when I'm not feelin shaved ice, I just go there for their dole whip or ice cream. They have yummy ice cream flavors, like white chocolate macadamia or green tea (my personal favorite).

Definitely stop by at least once when you're in Sawtelle and you want an alternative to the never ending boba or blockheads!</Review>

<Text>I am posting this to first and foremost RECOGNIZE this amazing family-owned business and their dedication to their customers. Today, April 28th, 2021 is a tough day for this family. Early this morning, the owner of The Sandwhich Spot (East Elk Grove) gained his wings after a long fight with a rare lung disease. To the Sandwich Spot family, we send our love and condolences as you mourn the loss of a husband, father, and grandfather.

If you were/are a frequent customer of this shop then you most likely know that this beautiful, loving and hard-working family values every single one of their customers!

As a loyal customer and human being, I hope that everyone would be respectful and mindful of any store hour changes because this is real life! Yes business is business, but family is everything! If you need a sandwich, Subway is down the street. In the meantime, let the family grieve and have their time, and when you are ready to reopen, we are ready to support.

Fly High Maxizamus & Ofa Lahi Atu<//Text>< pictures>

<Review>I've visited this location a few times and was not impressed. I decided to give it another shot and had a number 12 on Dutch crunch. I placed a phone order and they had everything ready to go upon my arrival. When I opened the sandwich I was not impressed. There was hardly any meat on the sandwich. The bread tasted stale and was definitely not the fresh Dutch crunch I am used too from other locations. They used to serve green leaf lettuce and must have recently switched to shredded ice burg.  They were very light on the veggies. It was mostly a bread sandwich. There was probably 4 strips of onion on the entire sandwich. Overall once again, I feel cheated for spending that much on a crummy sandwich. I walked out with a drink and chip spending about $12. Safe to say I will not be returning.< /Review>< user_name>

< username>
Luna Gomez<//username>
<time>1592937746564<//time>< text>
Nice place..people were very nice and friendly< /text>
<gmap_id>0x80c2d812eb1b80f9:0xa80e44a2799e7686< /gmap_id></record></dataset><record>
<response>None< /response>< text>
01-05-2018
Not enough signage to really help the driver know what lane to be in. (Left lane to scale coming in).
Gate people disinterested in truck drivers was my feeling. Check-in window at docks the gal was helpful.
Scale at the docks is registers under weight my guess is about 500 pounds.
When I told security, the man at the exit gate seemed angry when i reported my tandem axles were at 34200.
Not too much but my steers showed 11100.
That's when the flags in my brain went up. My girl tanks were almost full and the steers generally weigh in at 11700.
This is a legacy operation akin to Safeway or Del Monte or the old businesses that have been around so long they cannot operate efficiently like say Costco DC and some of the newer places that do not hold the driver up 5 6 or seven hours for a twenty minute job.
(Big sigh)
They took one pallet off the back, I'm all better now.
Still, 5 hours to load...
Just saying.< /text>
<Rating>3</Rating>< username>
Ken Saylor</username>

< Review>
My first time here so wasn't sure what to expect based on some previous reviews from other truckers. The guy at the g/s was very friendly and courteous and I was in and out within an hour with a preloaded trailer. They dont have an axle scale but you can scale with your steers, drives and trailer separately on their scale and just do the math.< /Review>

< Text>
The guards at the shack don't seem to care about drivers and tend to get pissy when you ask them questions. I do a dedicated account so everything there for me is drop and hook. There are very little signs telling you where to go for what you need, so be sure to ask the guards what the procedures are and where to go to check in to get loaded or unloaded. From what I seen it takes hours to get loaded, and I believe this is a union shop, which explains why it takes hours to for them to do anything.</Text>

Slow: arrived for 10:00pm appointment, load not ready for >14 hours. Shipping tells security staff nothing. Scale at shipping dock is uncalibrated and shows too heavy. When you are loaded too heavy the shipping staff will refuse to unload overage until you get a scale ticket and are directed to go off site. Luckily there are scales at the security gate and security will call shipping if you are over total gross. They will not scale by axle here however.</Review>

<gmapID>0x80dd26c68de0e57b:0xe4ee645464b44022</gmapID>< review>
My family has been using Huntington Pacific Insurance for years. Just today  I tried to get a new insurance policy through Tesla for a new car and they told me that I had 3 points (which didn't make any sense) because of traffic tickets. They said that my rate would be $270 a month. I thought I had no choice and purchased the policy.

Luckily, I decided to call Tania at Hunting Pacific to see if she could do better. She immediately discovered that the alleged points were not valid and quoted me a price $100 cheaper a month. I contacted Tesla and they admitted they had made a mistake. Had I not called Tania I would have literally paid an extra $1200 for no reason.

I cancelled the policy with Tesla and bought the new one off Huntington Pacific. I cant recommend them enough to the public. They are beyond fast, know their stuff, and are able to work policies in a way that gets you the best coverage and rates around.

Thank you to their team and Tania in particular.<//review>

<Rate>1< /Rate><Review>While "Katy" was very professional in her demeanor and seems highly versed in the technical aspects of my furnace, I was surprised by the lack of specificity in the diagnoses. It could be this, this or this.  Which leads me to question, do service tech earn commission on repairs? In other words, the more parts and labor they sell, the bigger their paycheck?

Is this ethical?  Sadly, I ran into this same issue about a year or two ago with Anderson and my AC condenser. The repair estimate was $6K.  I ended up fixing it myself for $200 and it's worked perfectly ever since.

Today‚Äôs repair estimate  $1,788 + $68 for the service call. The parts, which I found online, are less than $285, and I question if they are both necessary. Labor time to replace these two suggested parts, or three suggested parts is 45 minutes for an experienced tech,  double for a novice.

With this second instance of what I believe are questionable at best business practices, and more likely unethical ones, obviously supported by management I will not use your company for any service or future sales.

UPDATE - March 2021
Apparently my review struck a nerve. Received a call and a full refund of my $68 service call fee. Despite my reluctance to deal with a huge plumbing service, I requested a plumber from Anderson to come out and evaluate why my bathroom sink drain continues to clog only 1-2 months after having it cleaned out. I was clear when booking the appointment that I did not want an 'unclog' service but for an actual plumber to come assess my issue.

Afternoon appointments are supposed to be from 12-4pm but the technician did not arrive until 5pm. When she arrived I explained what I was looking to do, just as I had explained it to the dispatcher. I proceeded to show her the issue and she removed the drawers from my bathroom sink in order to look at the plumbing.

After looking at the plumbing she indicated that she could clear the clog but it would happen again due to the drain. I explained that the purpose of the service call was to evaluate and take the steps needed to permanently resolve the issue and I was happy to replace all plumbing if needed to resolve this issue.

She continued to recommend that I have her fix the issue so the drain flows for ~$150, and have someone else come look at the drain with a camera. When I explained that I didn't want to spend $150 on a temporary fix when I was going to pay to replace the plumbing, the technician gave me attitude and left without reinstalling the drawers into my sink cabinet.

It has been difficult to get ahold of anyone at Anderson to resolve the issue. I have requested my money back and will use a different plumber to complete my project.</Text>

108036070830104909731< /userid>
<user_name>Y. Song< /user_name><Date>1613984028526</Date>< Rate>
1<//Rate>
<Text>Update:
Erin, Anderson's Client Relations Manager reached out via email and explained their policy of flat rate per type of the job.  She offered 15% off on the water pressure regulator job and removed the charge for accessing the valve. While I recognize the effort to provide good customer care (along with multiple text, email and phone call asking for feedback)  I cannot say I'm remotely happy about this flat rate charge that's 3-4 time higher than being reasonable.

===========================================================
Anderson Plumbing's charge is absurdly high! I had a technician come to fix a leaky waterline going into the fridge. while doing that he also found the water pressure was high and I agreed to have the water pressure regulator replaced.

He had to cut a small hole on the drywall to access the pipe, which took him 30 seconds, and the charge is $323. Note this is only for cutting the hole, not including any repair work, and they will not fix the drywall afterwards. The actual repair work of replacing the water supply line's connection valve is another $323, which I'm ok with, since at least the technician spent 30 minutes on it.

The most ridiculous one is the $1,485 charge for replacing the water pressure regulator. The part is $180 according to the technician, and it's a quick job taking him literally less than 10 minutes using only a plumbers plier. I found out afterwards a reasonable cost for this should be in the $300 range including the part, and feel quite bad not doing enough research and being an informed customer beforehand. I wish everyone else considering calling them have the chance to read the reviews beforehand and be aware of their practice of overcharging to an outrageous extent.

I do agree that it was easy for me to make the appointment, and the technician came on time and finished the job quickly in a professional manner. But I'd not be able to recommend their services to anyone due to the extremely unreasonably high cost.<//Text><Pics>None< /Pics><resp>{'time': 1613771018626, 'text': 'Thank you Y. Song for your review and bringing to our attention your dissatisfaction. Our Client Relations Manager has reached out privately to address your concern.  We do hope to resolve the situation for you, please contact Erin, to discuss. Thank you, Anderson PHA'}< /resp>< gmap_id>

The plumber had no clue, he could not detect the source and wrongly advised that the leak was coming from the bathroom upstairs. They charged us $365 for nothing and never send us a report. After multiple follow ups still till date no report has been given. We ended up calling another plumber who very quickly detected the leaking dishwasher at almost $100 cheaper. He also help fixed the leak and helped us with drying company and dishwasher company.

I would never use Andersen Plumbing ever again and advise everyone to stay away from them.

Subsequent to this review I had a very good follow up from Andersen and they have since rectified their response and have successfully resolved the matter to my satisfaction.

Thank you Andersen for prompt followup.<//Review>

<Review>I was quoted to replace a 40 gallon water heater at 3990. Of course this must have included a waterless system which I wasn't given both options. My wife had to meet them being I got held up and I'm starting to think maybe a little hoodwink was in place when wifey opened the door cause do the math. 40 gallon brand-new water heater is no more than 600 home depot, search online and find an installer for 200 to 250 tops, now we at 850 and this is a high 850, it could be at least minus 200 from that depending on thriftiness in ones blood. However, of course the water damage was way to extensive for Anderson plumbing so they needed another company one they suggested to come dry out sheet rock in the garage, hehehe. Not sheetrock in the breathing area within the home but off in the garage that was hardly bad, my house fan could dry it up in 5 hours . However, to get all done we were looking at 4000 to 5000. Oh us military have a whopping 3 percent discount , ooohhhh. Just keep that 3 percent and invest into a little moral dignity and remember what it was like when you started out Mrs Andersen, not everyone has la jolla strip mall money, and to be women owned part of a special population you would think they wouldn't try to get over on a wife filling in for husband or 3 percent might actually go to 10 percent for another special population in military and that 5000 is 2 military paychecks just to get water hot, hell I could rent two recruits from mcrd to sit and blow their hot breath on the tank and it be more morally inline than 5000 dollars for 40 gallons of water but wait they were trying to upgrade our whole system cause they must have insider scoop my housing area is turning into a strip mall where 5000 seems bout right when it also has a 24hr fitness inside the mall, ridiculous, .I just paid 75 for a water heater and 250 to install from facebook marketplace, Anderson you ought to be ashamed of the robbery you just attempted . <Review>I had issues with my heating, plumbing and air conditioning all on the same day. The representative that answered the phone when I called made sure I had an immediate appointment the next day and I was kept apprised of when the technician(s) would be arriving and also whether there was an earlier slot available so that I wouldn't have to wait.

All 3 of the technicians arrived on time and made me feel comfortable that they would resolve the problem.

Donald and Reggie, who handled the plumbing did a wonderful job! They explained everything to me and had me watch as they were doing the work. I have additional work to be done and they gave me options so that I could choose the most cost effective solution for my home and made an appointment to finish the work as soon as possible. Both were very competent, professional and personable and managed to resolve my issue, which gave me peace of mind.

The same was true for Mike, who handled my heating and air conditioning issues. He took the time to thoroughly diagnose and troubleshoot the problems and to make sure I was satisfied with his work before I left. I felt the pricing was reasonable given the fact that the work was warrantied by the company directly and none of them tried to pressure me into choosing a more expensive option. Reggie explained the rationale behind why it would be better to spend a little extra when it came to replacing two of the faucets in my bathroom.

All 3 left their contact info with me so I could reach them if there were any further problems and assured me that the company warranted their  work. They all also talked to me about the company's current promotions but didn't push me into going for any of them.

I had a very positive experience with Anderson Plumbing, Heating and Air and I would definitely work with this company again!<//Review><Pics>None< /Pics>< Response>

<Rating>5< /Rating>< Text>
Eric Weismann at Anderson Plumbing is amazing!! My entire experience with Anderson Plumbing was perfect and their office staff is right on par with the way customer service is supposed to be. This is probably the only company I have experienced in San Diego who makes the customers concerns an actual priority. Before I contacted Anderson plumbing I had spent 3 weeks working with my home warranty to get someone out to look for a hard to find water leak. That company spent 2 days trying to find it and were very unprofessional. I kicked them out and called Anderson Plumbing. Within 3 hours of calling they had a technician (Eric) at my house! An hour later, Eric was able to tell me exactly where the leak was (under the slab in the garage) and walked me through the house to show me the route of all my water pipes. Eric with Anderson gave me a quote that was roughly $2000 less than the company my home warranty provided. That other Company ended up being off on the location of the leak by about 30 feet and wanted to jack hammer the slab in my bathroom. Thank God for Eric and Anderson Plumbing and their quality leak detection equipment and skill. If you want it done right you had better call Anderson Plumbing!</Text>

< username>
James Christensen<//username>
<Time>1537325674206< /Time>< rate>
5<//rate>
<text>James B from Anderson is a fantastic plumber. I thought the drain from the toilet to the main line was blocked but he ran a few tests and determined the blockage was actually in the low-flow toilet itself. The problem was that the flush handle was not being held down long enough with the result that  the bowl was getting insufficient water so  toilet paper was not being pushed through the trap (located in the toilet) to the sewer pipe. On these low flow toilets you can't just press and release the handle- if you do the flapper valve will close prematurely. You must press and hold the handle down to keep the flapper valve open until all the water in the tank has entered the bowel.< /text>< Pics>
None</Pics>

James Blacker saved us from a very challenging clog in our main sewer outlet. He tried twice to reach it through an undersized cleanout, hoping to save us the cost to remove and replace the toilet - but this old house would not give up the fight so easily. James then consulted with me and I agreed to remove the toilet to give him better access. James doggedly refused to give up until he had a tricky reclosing congestion fully cleared. This was not routine (nothing in our old house ever is), but James rose to the challenge.

Anderson is lucky to have James Blacker. So were we.</review>

< Text>
When I first called Anderson Plumbing it was to fix the thermostat on my air conditioner. They told me that the unit was old (7 years old) and could not be replaced. That I would need to put in a new unit with new air conditioners. Having spent thousands of dollars with this company I figured that I had enough experience with them so that I could call them to fix a simple problem with the hot water in my shower. When they came I was told that I needed a new water softener unit for another few thousand dollars but my shower was fixed for the time being.
A couple of days later,when I had the same problem with the hot water in my shower, I made another appointment. At this appointment ,with another technician, I was told that I needed a different unit ,for another few thousand dollars, and the unit the first technician told me I needed wouldn't work. At this point I decided that I needed a second opinion from another company. In the meantime I found that the last guy they sent out had broken the hot cold water mixer on my shower. They escalated the problem to a repair supervisor who came out that week. He told me that they would have to replace the mixer on my shower, at no cost to me, and would call me in 2 days with an update as well as the exact cost of the new water softener unit he said I needed.
Two weeks later I still hadn't heard back from him. On the third week I received a message on my machine stating that the mixer had to be ordered from the manufacturer  and he would call me back the next day to discuss it. He had already tols me that it had to be replaced and I had foolishly assumed that he would do that first thing not three weeks later.
Three months later I still hadn't heard back from Anderson when I received an email message telling me it was time to make a service appointment on my air conditioners. I wrote back that I wouldn't be making any appointments with Anderson and to please remove me from their mailing list. That day I got a phone call from a very nice understanding lady who stated she was new to the job but that she was trying to straighten out problems that customer had had. She told me she would call Jose,the supervising technician who had come out the last time, and get back to me. True to her word she called me back the next day and informed me that she had ordered the part. She offered to call me every week to keep me updated which I declined.
Finally,after months, I got a call from her that the new part had come in and we made an appointment to install it.
The next time I tried to use my shower I found that only scalding hot water was coming out. No cold water to mix the hot water with. I called them to tell them what the situation was and she offered to send Jose back out to check on the problem. She informed me that since I had a tankless hot water system sometimes it took some time for the new unit to adjust. Now this explanation made no sense to me and if it makes sense to you then I'd suggest Anderson for your plumbing needs. It seems that in fixing one problem they always create a new one. To have them come out to try to fix it would be free but even at free it's far to expensive for me.
I wouldn't recommend Anderson to anyone  They're always   trying to sell you something new and can't seem to be able to do what they are hired to do correctly.
Stay far far away from this company.

Mark Schwartz< /Text>
<Time>1569429365917< /Time><Pics>None< /Pics><Rating>1< /Rating></record></dataset><record>
<user>110867913853047986838</user><Name>Jeremy Stewart<//Name><date>1462331236214<//date><Rate>1<//Rate>< Text>
I called Anderson to inquire about completely replacing my HVAC system in my home. When I scheduled the appointment I was assured someone would be at my home at a specific time, and that person would contact me the day of the appointment to confirm. On the day of my appointment, I never received a phone call, and even at the time of my appointment no one showed up.  20 minutes after when my appointment was going to be I had to contact Anderson to find out what happened. The operator for Anderson said "yes I see you at an appointment set for a specific time, let me see where our person is" then I was told "they will be there in 15 minutes". Well 25 minutes later and still no show, so I had to contact Anderson again. This time the operator started out giving me attitude saying "you don't understand, we don't set specific times for appointments, we give time frames".  I was then placed on hold for about 10 minutes while the operator called the person to see where they were. When the operator returned they said "Our man is at your front door right now". I about snapped because I was standing out front of my house waiting and saw nobody.  I wonder how a company that says they have great customer service can treat someone like this who isn't even their customer, and is looking to them to become their customer. If a company is this unprofessional, rude and disrespectful I would not want them doing any business with me, let alone in my house.< /Text>

<Date>1535235701368<//Date><Rate>5<//Rate>< user_id>
110603913851782269625<//user_id>
< resp>

<review>After a number of calls to various plumbing companies I got in contact with Anderson plumbing.  I had a leaking pipe and all companies were booked for the new week out or longer.  Anderson however took the time to check for any cancellations on a Friday and said they could have someone out later that afternoon.  My technician was Ken and he was super friendly and helpful with all the questions I had.  Our leak was in the attic and we have a tankless water system.  The area where our leak was had been over complicated with a number of bends and unused feed off points.  Ken replaced the copper piping and simplified the water flow for less stress on the piping.  He took the time to turn on all the faucets after repairs to flush all the air in the lines and showed me the new piping that he replaced to make sure he answered any questions I might have.  Anderson plumbing and Ken were very professional.  From talking to the booking agent on the phone to having all my questions answer to finding someone to come out so I didnt have to worry for an entire weekend.  Great company and I highly recommend them!!!!</review>< Pictures>
None<//Pictures>
< Name>

<Time>1535235701368<//Time><rating>5<//rating><Review>After a number of calls to various plumbing companies I got in contact with Anderson plumbing.  I had a leaking pipe and all companies were booked for the new week out or longer.  Anderson however took the time to check for any cancellations on a Friday and said they could have someone out later that afternoon.  My technician was Ken and he was super friendly and helpful with all the questions I had.  Our leak was in the attic and we have a tankless water system.  The area where our leak was had been over complicated with a number of bends and unused feed off points.  Ken replaced the copper piping and simplified the water flow for less stress on the piping.  He took the time to turn on all the faucets after repairs to flush all the air in the lines and showed me the new piping that he replaced to make sure he answered any questions I might have.  Anderson plumbing and Ken were very professional. <Review>After a number of calls to various plumbing companies I got in contact with Anderson plumbing.  I had a leaking pipe and all companies were booked for the new week out or longer.  Anderson however took the time to check for any cancellations on a Friday and said they could have someone out later that afternoon.  My technician was Ken and he was super friendly and helpful with all the questions I had.  Our leak was in the attic and we have a tankless water system.  The area where our leak was had been over complicated with a number of bends and unused feed off points.  Ken replaced the copper piping and simplified the water flow for less stress on the piping.  He took the time to turn on all the faucets after repairs to flush all the air in the lines and showed me the new piping that he replaced to make sure he answered any questions I might have.  Anderson plumbing and Ken were very professional.  From talking to the booking agent on the phone to having all my questions answer to finding someone to come out so I didnt have to worry for an entire weekend.  Great company and I highly recommend them!!!!< /Review><Name>Steve Bates</Name><Gmap_id>0x80d95825767feffd:0x9128f1cbf9c2d015</Gmap_id>< user_id>

<Time>1532280238695< /Time>< rating>

<review>Smelled gas coming from beneath our stove, which is very alarming. Shut off the valve underneath, aired out the kitchen, but hours later still smelled a bit of gas. Called something like 5 different plumbers asking for help as I have three young kids in the house and a wife who is due to have our fourth ANY MINUTE! Very much a serious situation. Despite this, every plumber I called either didn't respond or they were too busy to help. Then, I realized a family member recently used Anderson and she gave me the name and number of the actual technician that helped her out so I gave them a call and asked for James by name.  They appreciated how urgent this situation was, and James came out right away. He and his teammate arrived and were pleasant to work with from the start. They were always professional, and obviously experts at what they do. Throughout the entire process they communicated with us frequently so we always knew what was going on, what progress they've made, what their recommendations are, and what options we had. They were also very clear and direct with the costs associated with each option, and we never felt pressured into paying some exorbitant amount for optional services. They worked hard the entire time, being very sensitive to my family's particular situation. After the gas leak was fixed, James came back a few more times in the following days to do further tests to make absolutely certain things were done right and that everything was still holding up after they made the repairs. He even came out personally to meet with underground leak detection services (a third party), spoke to city gas company on our behalf to get our gas turned back on, and worked directly with the city inspectors office to get all the appropriate inspections and paperwork in order. Now, my family has gas service again! More importantly, this means we have a working clothes dryer, furnace, and HOT WATER. I could not have asked for a better experience in an otherwise really difficult situation.</review>< Pictures>
None<//Pictures>

< text>
Anderson Plumbing has completely unreasonable prices. Honestly, I really can't understand how they can have so many 5 star reviews unless people really don't care how much they pay for plumbing service.  Here are the facts of my case: I had a plumbing leak which they located for $262 when two other plumbers where quoting $130 for leak location.  I went with Anderson since they were the first to be able to come to my house.  After they found it they quoted $900 to repair a simple copper elbow. Another company quoted me a third the cost over the phone. Then came and fixed it in less than 30 mins.  It is sad to think some customers unfamiliar with plumbing rates trusting a company's quote as fair and paying literally $1800 per hour for a simple job, but if you go with Anderson be prepared for that sort of sticker shock.  Funny their tag line is "Nobody wows customers like we do."  Wow!<//text>

<review>I called Anderson Plumbing to repair a bathroom sink drain that was leaking. <user_id>105146965542274792337<//user_id>< text>
We called Anderson Plumbing because we had a slab leak.  Erik Egerstrom,  the plumbing technician came out in a timely manner.  He spent a lot of time looking for the leak and explaining everything to us.  He recommended that we call a leak detection company, which we did.  He followed up with us, and came out to give us a quote on repair.  He worked with us on pricing and was very professional and honest about what we needed and didn't need.  When he came to do the work, he and his apprentice got here at 9:30 AM and worked until 10:30 PM  because he wanted to make sure we had water for the weekend.  He then followed up after the weekend and finished the rest of the work.  Erik was professional, very knowledgeable and best of all honest!!  The drywaller and office staff were wonderful as well.  Thank you Anderson!!</text>

<time>1538511317656<//time><text>Ron, the plumber was great! . I told him the property was in the middle of selling and we needed this I spection for the buyers today. We had requested a non intrusive camera scope to verify if there was a leak or moisture inside the wall. When he walked in empty handed I asked if he had the camera with him, he replied no, then I went off and reacted terribly.  Even though I was a l irrate, he remained calm.  I told him the owner specifically requested it when she ordered them to come out.  He immediately called his office to see what the issue was and found out that for some reason, whomever took the appointment did not put that in the call notes.
He calmly recommended some options of cutting into the wall and what that cost would be, or would have to wait until the plumber with the scope could be scheduled. We decided to remove a piece of drywall ourselves so he could look in and he thoroughly inspected the area visually and what he couldn't see he stuck his arm in the wall to feel around for any water or dampness. He was gracious the entire time and explained everything so clearly and calmed me down.  He also wrote up the findings on his tablet and emailed it directly to us while he was still on site. What a fantastic man and employee you have!  Sincerely, Denise Lisa, the owners realtor. I will definitely recommend your company to all of my clients. <rating>5<//rating><Review>Had problem with a toilet wobbling and leaking water from under base.  Problem was caused by previous plumber incorrectly setting a new toilet in place by trying to use two wax seals to make up for the flange being lower and not flush with the finished tile floor level.  Alex installed a new flange, level with the finished floor, and a new wax seal and then set the new toilet in place, using shims to eliminate any wobbling, and finally caulked around the entire base.  Alex was professional, courteous, and explained fully what he had to do, what the cost would be before he proceeded, then did the work and thoroughly cleaned up after himself when the work was completed.  will certainly use the company again if and when the need arises.<//Review><Pics>None</Pics><resp>None</resp><GmapID>0x80d95825767feffd:0x9128f1cbf9c2d015<//GmapID></record></dataset><record>

< user>

< review>
I used Anderson for their plumbing services and I was satisfied with that work.  Despite being over priced, I liked both of the technicians who came to my house.  However, I am EXTREMELY dissatisfied with HVAC services that I received.  The technician came to my house and instead of assessing all possible options (which I later learned there were other, cheaper options), he went straight to the $1300 blower motor option, which knowing nothing about HVAC, I figured that was what was needed.  The technician installed the blower motor and it worked for less than 24 hours.  Anderson came back and this time brought back a salesman who tried to pressure me into spending 9-10 THOUSAND dollars on a completely new system.  I felt very uncomfortable about the sales tactics and I could tell that my technician was also uncomfortable.  Eventually the salesperson left and the technician agreed to try a simple remedy, adding refrigerant to the system.  They were originally going to try to charge me $200 for this, but decided to spare me the expense.  The system worked for only a few hours.  I eventually changed the outlet and that got the system working for a couple of weeks.

It broke again, and after talking to other professionals in the area and my family friend back at home about it, they explained that I was completely ripped off and completely overcharged for something that failed to work.  They also explained that the prices that they were quoting me for a new system were completely absurd.  I feel completely taken advantage of; the company realized that my spouse and I were not savvy in the HVAC realm and they pounced on the opportunity to make as much money from us as possible.

I ultimately hired a new professional to fix my broken system and they explained that the motor that was installed by Anderson had already broke and also that there were other fixes to try prior to replacing the blower motor originally.  I tried to get some or all of my money back from Anderson, but they were very difficult to reach, have given me the runaround, and refuse to do anything because I did not give them the opportunity to fix the problem.  I explained that I know that they took advantage of me and that I was uncomfortable with their sales tactics and they just choose to slander the professional that I used to fix the problem and try to affix the blame on me in any way possible.

If you cannot tell, I am completely dissatisfied with the assistance that I received from Anderson and I will never use them ever again and will be sure to tell anyone who will listen to never use them again.  They just want your money and will pretend to be helpful and charming in an attempt to get you to trust them and spend all kinds of money on things that you do not need.

**Update**
Erin and her team helped resolve the issue and I am grateful that she took the time to reach out to me to see what was going on and make sure that we were taken care of.</review>

<Review>Contacted Anderson Plumbing for a slab leak. Brian was the tech that came out, and he gave us a recommendation and the cost. Did a copper re-rout that led to the kitchen. A week later another copper pipe leak showed up in a different area. Requested that Brian come back out to investigate. Found a pin hole leak in the copper pipe which he spot repaired to stop the leak. Based on the two leaks we discussed a full copper re-pipe of the house. We decided to go this route as we have been spared of water damage up to this point. We requested that Brian do the work. Brian does excellent work. He plans things out, does not rush, keeps the house clean by using plastic around the work area, and makes sure we have use of some running water while replacing the old piping. At this time (because all the plumbing was being disconnected) we replaced a toilet  and some tub and shower valves. This was a big job and we appreciate Brian's dedication. < text>
Larry was very courteous, answered my questions and tried to trouble shoot the problem.    He was on time, respected my property.  What he did not do was remove the trap.  I did not ask him to but when he ran water and could not reproduce the back up of water in the sink, he might have thought of that.  I thought of it later the night and asked the next person who looked at the sink when it backed up again to do that.  We found a child's toothbrush which had obviously been in there for some time.  I am not faulting him but the next time I would definitely make sure the trap be removed from a sink that is backing up.

I also had Zak B. out for the same problem.  Again he ran water, tried to reproduce the blockage.  We went over everything that had been done the day before, we checked the clean out on the side of the building and then I asked him to remove the trap on the sink.  He did and we found a child's toothbrush in the trap.  Again if I had not asked to have it removed the problem would have recurred.  I am happy I asked but I think the technician should know to remove a trap if they can't reproduce the blockage with running water.  Something has to be causing the sink to backup several times.</text>

<Review>I called Anderson to have a broken disposer replaced. Calling the job in already a great experience - ''How can I make you smile today?'' just works! Justin M. impressed me right away, because he listened to my problem description, then assessed the work involved, presented me with the options available. I chose, he did the rest - a sizable job as it turned out. In-between and after having finished, he warned me that, perhaps, another unrelated problem might arise in the near future. He counseled me on the work to be done, if that were the case. Justin explained everything very well. He also asked me if there were other problems and, on me mentioning one, he took care of it. The parts that he needed were on the Anderson truck - they are fully stocked as the advertisement says. Justin left the job site clean and tidy. The part that he had mentioned might be on the brink of failure actually did fail a few hours later. I called it in, the time was set and Justin took care of the rusted out part the next day, same time. No fuzz, no huff and puff, Anderson and Justin just did it. <Name>heather sullivan</Name><date>1501022984115</date><rating>5< /rating><text>Tried Anderson Plumbing, Heating, and Air for the first time. Having only one full bath, it was a bit of an emergency when the shower wouldn't drain, and dripping faucets were rapidly filling the shower stall. Technician James, attempted to clear the blockage, but only got 2 feet into the drain. After informing him of old cast iron pipes in the crawl space beneath our house, he called a camera specialist, Ricardo, to determine the problem. We needed a new trap and 10 foot length of modern-day "code" pipe. James was able to temporarily stop the dripping faucets. Unfortunately, we weren't able to schedule the fix-up for a week later.

One week later: Larry, a very knowledgeable man with plenty of on-the-job experience, and a supervisor as well, arrived about 8:30 AM (on time), fully explained all of the work that was to be done, and answered all of our questions. Then he went right to work. The beneath the house work was accomplished pretty quickly, but the new, Moen, single handle faucet kit was a bit of a challenge. Larry had to remove an area of tile, and saw through 2-inch concrete and lathe in our "vintage" shower stall. When the job was completed (by mid-afternoon), the shower drained well (with its modern, 4 inch pipe), and we had a shiny Moen faucet/plate and shower head. They were so well-installed that one couldn't tell that they were replacements. No damage to the existing tile and well-sealed.

On the same-day that James and Ricardo came out, (at different times), I was only charged $42. Ricardo prepared the cost, with options. In my opinion, the fee for the option that I chose, was fair, considering the time, labor, and parts involved. On repair day, no attempt to oversell, no surprises. My white tiled bathroom was left clean, and undamaged. Larry even wore shoe covers to protect my dark hardwood floors and oriental rugs where he had to pass through the house.

I definitely will call Anderson again for its caring, knowledgeable, experienced, professional service for plumbing repairs on my OLD house. Thank you, James, Ricardo, and Larry.< /text><pictures>None</pictures>< Response>

<resp>{'time': 1530905589998, 'text': '***RESOLVED*** We were able to provide Mr. Roque with the necessary information for him to contact the city regarding his issue. Thank you Mr. Roque for working with me to get this taken care of for you. We hope that your situation gets handled, please let us know if there is anything further you need.\n\nThank you Mr. Roque for your review and bringing to our attention your dissatisfaction with your call out to us. My name is Erin, I am our Client Care Manager here at Anderson PHA. I was able to pull up your account and research the details. First I would like to apologize that we were not able to get out to you sooner, we were very busy due to the Holiday, and we sincerely apologize that you had to call another company out. We are very glad I was an easy clearing for you. Our intentions are to be able to get to every client that needs us, unfortunately that isn\'t the case always.\nI also was able to get information on the estimate given for the camera and report requested. Our normal camera charge is $250.00, and an additional fee to place findings on a flash drive for your records. However, when a client needs a "Plumbers Report" there is more to just the camera-ing of the line. Because the city will not take the report from a homeowner, only a licensed plumber- our technicians have to camera the line, place the findings on a disc, write up an official findings report, take these to the city and file the report along with their form- this is why the price increased. I was also informed that the city will not do anything regarding roots in the line, corrosion or build up. There has to actually be a break, or collapse in the line for them to come out and repair/replace. If the line is able to be hydro-jetted to clear out roots or buildup- they will expect the homeowner to take care of this at their expense. I hope this gives a little more insight to your concern. I know it doesn\'t help that we were not available sooner to come out, please call me directly if you have another issue and I will work directly with a technician for you.\n\nSincerely,\nErin Hanson\nClient Care Manager\n619-449-3852\nAnderson PHA\nerinh@andersonpha.com'}< /resp><gmapID>0x80d95825767feffd:0x9128f1cbf9c2d015</gmapID></record>

< Review>
Very happy with my furnace and AC system including a new state of the art thermostat!  John Baer did a 5 star job listening to my concerns and was patient with my tenacity to ensure certain issues were resolved.
Areas that could be improved:

1.  Electronic contract administration.  i.e. could not open email to print/save contract which we changed a few times and called twice for a final copy which I still haven't received.

2.  Training on new products.  i.e. a snag installing the new thermostat which didn't get resolved until the next day, but they did resolve the issue professionally and was diligent in training the customer and ensuring the software was functioning on my cell phone.

3.  Patchwork to drywall.  i.e. we relocated the thermostat and the hole from existing location was poorly done.

These are easy things for the company to fine tune in their administration/installation process.< /Review>

In addition, Mike brought us with him and explained the diagnostic and repair process step by step.  We learned lots of useful information about air conditioning! He signed us up for a very valuable maintenance plan and gave us his cell number if we ever have any questions.  I would recommend Mike Gaskill's service to anyone!  Outstanding experience!!<//text>

<Text>I did not have a good experience with this company. I had them out to move a gas line and repair a leak coming from one of the fixtures in the upstairs bathtub. I usually try and stay home when people are working on the house for supervision and to answer questions, but this time I couldn't. Upon arriving home after work I found a 1 ft by 2 ft hole in the bathroom ceiling that was in the room adjacent to where the gas line was being moved and I received a message saying that I could not use my bathroom shower as the pipe below had been cracked. I do realize things happen on a jobsite, but this was a bit ridiculous. And to top it off, when I reached out to the plumber for clarification, he stated it was my fault and that I would have to pay to get everything fixed. He said he would "work with me" on the price but that he is "covered and took pictures." Being in the medical field, I liken this to a surgeon repairing a ACL, but in the meantime cutting the MCL. Apparently the gas line had fallen when he cut it which caused the hole in the spare bathroom ceiling and when he was unscrewing the drain plug, he broke the pipe below. After much argument, the plumber did agree to fix the pipe that was broke but I had to supply all of the parts and the hole in the ceiling I would have to fix. Overall, if you want your house to be in worse shape after you pay $1500, call this company.

After my review for this company I noticed that they had responded with a "we do not have you in our records, please call this number." I proceeded to call this number and express my concerns with their work. After leaving a message and waiting 2 weeks, I have now determined this must be an automated message by the company and this "we do not have your records on file" is a way to make them look like they care. Bad all around!!!< /Text>< Pictures>

< user_id>
105195650982475930255< /user_id>
<name>Bernard Hernandez<//name><Time>1461794267049</Time>< rating>
5</rating>
<text>This was my second experience with Anderson Plumbing, Heating and Air.  I was having issues with my upstairs bathroom sinks not draining.  I tried to fix it myself, but to no avail.  I decided to call Anderson Plumbing, Heating and Air because my previous experience with them was an excellent one.  I called a little later in the evening and was pleasantly surprised  that someone was there to take my call.  I was greeted with a warm, "Thank you for calling Anderson Plumbing, Heating and Air, how can I make you smile today?!"  What a nice way to greet your customers!  Right away, you know that you are going to be taken care of.  I was easily able to schedule an appointment.  The first appointment offered was on a Sunday.  That is so great that they could send someone over the weekend.  I knew I wasn't going to be home on Sunday so I made the appointment for the early 8-12pm window on Monday.  Usually when a company gives you a window of time, you can usually count on them coming at the end of the time, if not much later.  This is really inconvenient when you have to take half a day off of work just to wait for a technician.  Not the case with Anderson.  I got a call at 8am saying that the tech would arrive by 9am.  And he arrived by 9am!  Larry introduced himself, shook my hand, and asked for permission to enter my house.  Before he entered, he put on his booties without being asked.  After I explained my plumbing issue to him, he clearly explained what actions he needed to do and explained in detail what the cost was going to be.  I asked Larry if he would mind if I watched so I can learn how to fix a clog in the future.  He said, "Sure" and proceeded to educate me and explain step by step what he was doing and why and how the plumbing worked.  He was happy to do it and appeared genuinely proud of the work he was doing.  Many techs want to be left alone and don't want to be bothered.  Turned out that my drain issue was a bit complex.  Larry used his industrial auger, which put my 20 ft hand auger to shame.  When that did not work, be broke out the beast auger and that fixed the issue.  Despite having to go back and forth to the van to get supplies, despite having to go up and down and stairs, inside and outside the house, Larry stayed calm and collected, didn't mind removing and putting back on his booties.  When he finished his work upstairs, he cleaned up the entirety of his work area and then some.  He sprayed down the counters and glass with cleaner and he made sure he left the bathroom area nicer than when he arrived.  He even thanked me for my help, even though I was there observing to learn from him.  Larry recapped everything that he did, explained the warranty of his work, and made some recommendations without being one bit pushy or salesy.  I was so impressed by Larry's work ethic, professionalism, integrity, and passion for his craft.  Coincidentally, that day was "National Hug a Plumber Day".  To show my appreciation, I offered Larry a tip so that he can buy lunch or whatever.  He graciously said, "No thank you, it was my pleasure to serve you, use that to take your kids out to lunch."  What a great guy!

The next day, based on Larry's recommendation, William came over with his nifty video device.  In order to make sure that there were no other issues with my pipes, William fished his video camera down into my pipes.  We were able to clearly see inside the pipes, maybe 20 feet or so.  This was displayed on the video monitor.  When he was done, William said everything looked good, there was no additional blockage.  He recommended hydrojetting (washing) of the pipes, but at this point it was not an emergency, but should be done at some point in order to avoid future clogs.  I appreciated his honesty when he could have easily tried to upsell me.

This is a testament to what a great company Anderson is.  Built upon family values, they really take the time and effort to show that they care and appreciate their customers.  If you have any plumbing, heating or air issues, I recommend Anderson without reservation!</text><Pics>None< /Pics>< resp>

<Text>I needed some minor plumbing/fixture work done on my home to get it ready for a home inspection.  My typical plumber did not have availability within the time frame.  I remembered the AWSOME trucks I had seen around, and being a professional female myself, I thought I'd give them a try. Calling and scheduling the appointment was great--super professional without a long wait for service. The service charge was extremely reasonable as well. The guy arrived on time and was really nice.
Before entering the house, I showed him a water spicket that had a stripped handle on it. He said he would look at it before he left but it would be expensive (odd  I thought). One of the jobs was to have a "sticky" diverter (from bath to shower) loosened because it was gritty and difficult to manipulate.   No parts, not major work.  Problem:  the quote to have that done was $550!  Really.  $550.    I declined and showed him another bath tub  where the water stopper was not attached to the Kohler lever so the water would not drain.  He did not know how to fix the Kohler but suggested a toe tap drain.   This, I had to do because I needed it for an inspection. The charge: $330.  Really.  It took him 5 minutes.
He overheard me on the phone telling my real estate agent that the charge was too expensive and he apologized  stating that he didn't set the prices, he only enforced them.

After he left, I got a squirt bottle with vinegar and soaked and manipulated the gritty diverter.  Works just fine.  Really, Really disappointed.</Text><Gmap_id>0x80d95825767feffd:0x9128f1cbf9c2d015< /Gmap_id></record></dataset><record>

<UserId.>102963132401522800625</UserId.><username>George Richards</username><time>1457905270398< /time>< Rating>
5</Rating>
<text>Russel and John got tasked to correct a difficult Return Air ducting issue with a new install of a Lennox 4 ton HVAC unit in an older existing structure. The original Return ducting consisted of a single 12" round duct. The unit needed at least 1500 cfm, when it only had 600 cfm. I thought we could get another through the lower story into the mechanical room, but only a 6" was able to be installed due to framing and other mechanical systems interference. The solution,  since I did not want the exterior of the structure opened up, was to have the service tech, Russel, crawl up through a small opening in the ceiling of the outside mechanical room; upwards through a 2 story chase, in order to remove the existing 12" and cut in another 12' round to double that capacity. Both Russel and John never hesitated when evaluating the job. They jumped right in, finished in a remarkably short time, made the connections in extremely tight areas, worked cleanly and neatly. The A/C unit now produces the full 4 ton capacity with no problem. Kudos to these guys for their work and extremely positive attitudes, and know how; to be able to get a difficult remodel situation solved.
Thanks Guys.< /text><Pictures>None<//Pictures><resp>None<//resp><Gmap_id>0x80d95825767feffd:0x9128f1cbf9c2d015</Gmap_id></record>

< name>
Duke Windsor<//name>
<Date>1433820650295<//Date>< Rate>
5</Rate>
< Review>
I contacted SDG& E about a gas smell in my foyer.  They came out and found no gas readings in the home yet checked out the system and found it was changing pressure enough to warrant a complete gas turnoff and lock.  That was on June 2nd.  That same evening I contacted Anderson Plumbing on the web and was contacted that same evening to schedule a technician to come out.

Chris B was very professional.  He and his associate went through the system thoroughly and methodically assessing the situation.  Unfortunately, with this older structure finding the problem was difficult.  But through a process of elimination, Chris was able to narrow it down to an single location and had a theory on the possible issue.  He then proceeded to let me know of the delay in completion do to the fact that he wanted to be sure and not demo my home any more by using a helium test to pinpoint the problem.

The next day the problem area was found and the repairs were down quickly.  Unable to get the County to move faster they were not able to come out on Friday to sign off on this.  The whole weekend was a "no Hot Water"  weekend.

On Monday we got the County Inspector(if you can call him that.)  He immediately treated you staff as if they we amature Craigslist Handymen.  Telling them they did the repair all wrong and used the wrong hardware and proceeded in accusing Chris of not being "qualified"  to do the work because he didn't have a certification card.  He even said this work wasn't finished,  made them change a flex line in the furnace to a hard line( not why he was here by the way) and walked out as Chris tried to explain to him where was mistaken and that he is a professional at his work.  Chris was then, after at least 15 minutes convinced the inspector that he was right.  The inspector basic conditionally approved the turn-on.  And wanted Chris to return to shut off everything later this week so he can come back out and inspect the fixes himself and the pressure reading as well.  Preposterous Crap!

Well Chris got the job done and he and his associate(sorry I for got his name) was supurb, and after six days my wife can now washer her hair.  That's all that matters.

Thanks Chris
Thanks Anderson.

Duke Windsor<//Review>

So my air conditioner stopped putting out cold air, at least so I thought when it wouldn't cool my house in 30 minutes on a hot, hot, humid day. I called Anderson plumbing for no other reason than I like their television commercials (especially Mary Jean), and boy was I pleasantly surprised by the service call I received.
